posts.cooked:
I connected a vh 109 radio to a power supply, it started boot but stack on the boot process. 17422215241933931890729441090646 1884×4080 236 KB Thats the status of the leds Does anyone knows how to fix this bug? (This is a new radio)

posts.name: Emre
posts.cooked: I am not sure why this happens but in the website there is a critical known issue. https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/support/known-issues/1-flash-memory-corruption-causes-bootloop

link_counts.title: #1 Flash memory corruption causes bootloop | FIRST FRC Radio

posts.cooked: yeah, I heard about this issue but this is the first time I use this radio… it is new (I just opened its box)

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked: If you believe your radio is stuck in boot you need to contact support for remedy.
There is no a recovery process or another procedore that might fix this issue?

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked: To my knowledge the only further repair is to contact support. I have not experienced the failure but from other threads at the point its stuck in boot you either need to have a remote-support call and reprogramming of your device or RMA and replace it with a device that gets through boot into the application.

suggested_topics.title: moduleForces missing from Choreo trajectory
suggested_topics.excerpt: You’re using ChoreoLib version 2024.2.3, which added those fields, released in June (release notes) I’d guess those trajectories were generated with an earlier version, which didn’t include them.
